issue.title: [R] Error when reading integer-type columns
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-15792](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15792). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
I was reading files that I created on the same laptop, same R version and Arrow version 7.0.0. The error I get when reading int32-type columns is
```java

> source("~/github/un_escap/hs12-historic-series/00-create-historic-series.R")
2012
Error in `handle_csv_read_error()`:
! NotImplemented: Function 'equal' has no kernel matching input types (array[int32], scalar[string])
Run `rlang::last_error()` to see where the error occurred. 
```
Here's a minimal example of the code that caused this
```java

library(arrow)
library(dplyr)

d <- open_dataset("aggregate_level=0",
                  partitioning = c("trade_flow", "year", "reporter_iso"))

d %>%
  select(reporter, reporter_code, reporter_iso) %>%
  collect() 
```
After going back to Arrow R package v6.0.2, it worked. Here "reporter_code" is numeric.

I've attached a zip with the data.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15792?focusedCommentId=17502815) by Nicola Crane (thisisnic):*
Hi `[~pachamaltese]` - I tried to replicate this using the package version 7.0.0 with your example above and was unable to replicate it.  Just to check - are you still having the same issue? I've tested with a recent nightly build and the Linux binary for 7.0.0 but everything just ran fine with them.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15792?focusedCommentId=17502819) by Nicola Crane (thisisnic):*
Also, I'm wondering if there's actually some code in the script `"~/github/un_escap/hs12-historic-series/00-create-historic-series.R"` that is mentioned above that is causing the issue, but isn't included in the regex?  I'm thinking this because the error message shown looks like one which we encounter when something has gone wrong with a kernel, so I'd expect there to be a step like `filter(column = value)` which is the cause of the error here.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15792?focusedCommentId=17503170) by Mauricio 'Pachá' Vargas Sepúlveda (pachamaltese):*
Hi

 

I reinstalled Arrow v7.0.0 by following the exact instructions from the official docs.

 

I see this new error

 

 
```java

Error:
! "partitioning" does not match the detected Hive-style partitions: c("aggregate_level", "trade_flow", "year", "reporter_iso")
ℹ Omit "partitioning" to use the Hive partitions
ℹ Set `hive_style = FALSE` to override what was detected
ℹ Or, to rename partition columns, call `select()` or `rename()` after opening the dataset
Run `rlang::last_error()` to see where the error occurred.
```

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15792?focusedCommentId=17503451) by Nicola Crane (thisisnic):*
If you update the call to `open_dataset` to be `d <- open_dataset(data_path, partitioning = c("aggregate_level", "trade_flow", "year", "reporter_iso"))` then this should let you open it.

This is because of the "=" in the directory name - I think this warrants further discussion so have opened this ticket to work out if this is a bug or just the nature of Hive partitioning style directory names: ARROW-15880

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15792?focusedCommentId=17503705) by Nicola Crane (thisisnic):*
Sorry `[~pachamaltese]`, I've got a bit confused now - can you clarify which code you're saying working in 6.0.1 but not 7.0.0? `open_dataset` without specifying `aggregate_level` in the partitioning, or something else?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15792?focusedCommentId=17503721) by Mauricio 'Pachá' Vargas Sepúlveda (pachamaltese):*
Thanks. The same code, I did this
1. install Arrow 7.0.0, download the zip in this thread, open the RStudio project and source the script (it fails)
1. install Arrow 6.0.2, download the zip in this thread, open the RStudio project and source the script (it works)
   
   in both cases I did (my laptop uses `https://packagemanager.rstudio.com/all/__linux__/focal/latest` as default CRAN mirror)
   
    
   ```java
   
   Sys.setenv("NOT_CRAN" = TRUE)
   devtools::install_version("arrow", "x.y.z")
   ```

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15792?focusedCommentId=17504795) by Nicola Crane (thisisnic):*
`[~pachamaltese]` - I might need a different reprex to be able to replicate your error - we couldn't replicate your original error in version 7.0.0 using the short `open_dataset()` example above, so the error might actually stem from something else in the script you mention above.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15792?focusedCommentId=17536834) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
Feel free to reopen if you come up with a reprex.
